Author: jl777c#5810
Content: starting from https://github.com/guardaco/zcash-SPV which supports sapling, it seems we need to replace the header syncing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and change to a per-utxo validation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that can then invoke a series of p2p queries to find the notarizations bracketing the utxo, getting the headers between the first and last notarization, then validating that they link backwards properly. once that is done, a standard merkle proof for the utxo for whichever block it was in. at that point we know the utxo is "in" the merkleroot, which is in the block, which is in the segment of the blockchain that is notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: separately to this logic, we need a way to know what utxo an address has, so there will be some extra p2p messages supported that allow to query for notarizations, addressutxos/txids, txproofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nSPV avoids having to do the headers sync, which for bitcoin is only 80 bytes per block, but for equihash it is 2kb, so a much bigger issue for equihash coins. even for 80 byte headers, one million blocks is 80mb of data that is needed. nSPV for 80 byte headers would be less than 1kb of data plus txproof to validate a utxo

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: It's really interesting, I'm reading the code of the spv library

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so depending on what you compare to 100x, 1000x or 10000x less data

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Yes, if I understand your article is an huge improvement

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: And disruptive approach

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically achieves the same goals of flyclient without any complex math, not that there is anything wrong with complex math and fancy algo. just not something you can code up in a relatively small amount of time. with nSPV,  the code changes would be minimal

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Did you plan to write a paper ? I mean a PDF with full details ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems simple enough. does it need a paper? i think just need to define the p2p messages needed to support the nSPV clients

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getnotarization, getaddressutxos, gettxproof

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically mapping existing rpc calls to p2p message

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: It's simple, yes but it's very interesting

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: simple is not a pejorative, it is in fact a very good attribute. much less chance for bugs!
